children: A 57-year-old woman with systemic lupus erythematosus is evaluated for right hip pain.
A radiograph of the hips is
Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
The most likely diagnosis is osteonecrosis of the hip. In early osteonecrosis, plain radiographs are often normal. The earliest plain radiograph changes
increased density of the femoral head (
) followed by sclerosis and cyst development (
). Subchondral radiolucency, known as the "crescent sign," is pathognomonic of osteonecrosis and represents subchondral collapse. Later stages reveal flattening or collapse of the femoral head.

MRI is 100% sensitive in the diagnosis of osteonecrosis and is a particularly important imaging modality when plain radiographs are normal but clinical suspicion is high. The T1-weighted MRI of a different patient
subchondral fractures (T1 hyposignal) and flattening of the right femoral head characteristic of osteonecrosis.

objective.__html: Identify the radiographic findings of osteonecrosis of the hip.
